questions.question: Acronym for Central Processing Unit.
questions.explanation: CPU is the main processor that executes instructions.

questions.question: Acronym for Random Access Memory.
questions.explanation: RAM is temporary memory used while the computer is running.

questions.question: Acronym for Operating System.
questions.explanation: OS manages hardware and software resources.

questions.question: Acronym for Graphical User Interface.
questions.explanation: GUI provides visual interaction with computers.

questions.question: Acronym for Universal Serial Bus.
questions.explanation: USB is a standard for connecting peripheral devices.

questions.question: Acronym for Local Area Network.
questions.explanation: LAN connects computers in a limited geographical area.

questions.question: Acronym for Wide Area Network.
questions.explanation: WAN connects computers across large geographical distances.

questions.question: Acronym for Internet Service Provider.
questions.explanation: ISP provides internet access to customers.

questions.question: Acronym for HyperText Markup Language.
questions.explanation: HTML is the standard language for creating web pages.

questions.question: Acronym for Uniform Resource Locator.
questions.explanation: URL is the address used to access resources on the web.
